entry.title: RenijS: CSE2AIF-LISP-assignment1
entry.content: The first element = number of wolves on the east bank; the second = number of cats on the east bank; the third = the number of ducks on the east bank; the fourth = the location of the farmer.So initial list = (1 2 3 east). (The wolf will start a fight with any cats it shares a side with, unless the cats outnumber the wolf. Similarly, any cats on the same side as a duck will start a fight, unless there are more ducks than cats. But if the farmer is on the same side, he will prevent any fight before it starts.)
